page.title: 07Land Use in Pontypridd
page.content: From our school we can see the town, the new police station,car park and Old Bridge.We walk under the railway bridge past some big old houses.Some are being turned into flats and one is the Education office.The road goes through Old Graigwen to the new estates where most of us live and up to the Georgian houses at the top.The lovely big house,Maes-y-Deri,has just been knocked down and they are building Â£41,000 houses there.One day we walked from our school through the comprehensive school and up through the woods,passing houses on our left. We walked away from the houses to a field of ferns and blackberries where they are building a big new dormer bungalow.We went past the old coal level to the farm.Across the valley we saw the A470 Cardiff-Merthyr trunk road. (From Coed-y-lan school)
